description.narrative: Social protection system is strengthened with reinforced national capacity and more equitable, child and gender-sensitive, efficient, fiscally sustainable and shock-responsive social protection instruments,which contributes to Social Protection, Social Protection (Covid). UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Evaluations, Research And Data, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, United Nations Working Together. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2023 more vulnerable children benefit from social inclusion interventions guided by high-quality analysis on the policy environnment and public spending and strengthened by institutional support.

sector.narrative: Cash Transfers: Technical support to government cash transfer system development and expansion (design, targeting, beneficiary selection, grievance mechanism, cash delivery mechanisms like banking, mobiles, community distribution)
National social protection strategies: Policies, strategies, legislation and coordination (inter-ministerial, donor)
Shock responsive social protection - Strengthening social protection system for humanitarian response (preparedness)
Social services (incl youth development and women+ children)

title.narrative: Burundi United Nations Development Assistance Framework
Burundi Programme Strategy Note Theory of Change (Social Policy and Advocacy)
UNICEF Contract Awards through the UN Global Marketplace
Burundi 2018 Annual Report on Results for Children
Burundi 2019 Annual Report on Results for Children
Burundi 2020 Annual Report on Results for Children
UNICEF Tender Notices through the UN Global Marketplace

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Social protection system is strengthened with reinforced national capacity and more equitable, child and gender-sensitive, efficient, fiscally sustainable and shock-responsive social protection instruments

description.narrative: UNICEF provided technical assistance to the first national safety net programme, funded by the World Bank, under which 50,090 receive cash transfer and 13,000 households with children under 12 have already benefited from successful complementary interventions. In complement, the country office has continued to work with the Ministry of Social Affairs and the Social Protection Commission for the National statistics institute to strengthen the various building blocks of an integrated and comprehensive social protection system with a focus on national capacity development and strengthening the monitoring, and evaluation framework of the National Social Protection Strategy. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:27/12/2019

title.narrative: 2.7 Data management: Social protection data management system developed (management information systems, social and beneficiary registries, M and E systems)
Public investments in non-contributory social protection programmes in real per capita terms (in BIF/US$)
Number of households benefitting from new or additional social assistance measures provided by governments to respond to COVID-19 with UNICEF support [COVIDSitRep]
